Expected Result:
The Ether balance is shown on the overview.
The wallet address is shown on the overview.

Test Steps: Switch networks to a test network.
Expected Result: The Sepolia balance is shown on the overview. The wallet address is shown on the overview. The selected network is Sepolia.

Test Steps: Open the test dapp in another tab.

Expected Result:
The MetaMask popup is opened with the "Connect with MetaMask" screen displayed.
Your wallet account is selected.

Test Steps: Click "Next" and connect with the wallet account.
Expected Result:
The MetaMask popup is closed.
You are connected to the test dapp.

Test Steps: Click "Create token" to deploy a token contract.
Expected Result: The info modal with contract deployment fees is displayed.

Test Steps: Click "Confirm" and wait for the contract deployment transaction to be confirmed.
Notes: Custom token contract deployment time can vary for different networks.

Test Steps: Switch to the MetaMask wallet and click on the latest transaction in the "Activity" tab.
Expected Result: The contract deployment transaction status, nonce, amount, gas and total fees are shown in the transaction details.

Test Steps: Click on "View on block explorer" in the transaction details modal.
Expected Result: The block explorer opens in a new tab.

Test Steps: Switch to the test dapp in another tab.

Expected Result: The MetaMask popup with the request for setting a spending cap on the tokens will appear. Within the 'Custom Spending Cap' field, a value of "7" is displayed.

Test Steps: Remove the value of "7" and enter "2" as the new custom spending cap.
Expected Result: "2" is shown in the "Custom Spending Cap" field on the MetaMask popup.
The MetaMask popup with the request for a spending cap for "2" tokens and estimated gas fees will appear.
"Approve TST spending cap" transaction is displayed as "Pending" in the "Activity" tab.

Test Steps: Wait for the transaction status change to 'Confirmed".
Expected Result: "Approve TST spending cap" transaction is displayed as "Confirmed" in the "Activity" tab.

Test Steps: Proceed to view the transaction on block explorer.
Expected Result: Click on "View on block explorer" in the transaction details modal. The block explorer opens in a new tab.
